documents.document: Oh boy, school tomorrow. Finally getting into Senior year. Fun.
I don't know why, but I absolutely love this location. It looks so awesome. https://t.co/yu5Zeu6n7R
@SamTheTrainFan How come it looks like that for you?
Won't lie, this doesn't look all that great. Look at the huge gap. https://t.co/hLgZm5vGRb
@JonathanAsiama2 hmm what episode is this?
So, what's the verdict? Retweet for everyone :)
@CarsonMarenka Help us Carson. You're our only hope.
And that's a wrap. Will be doing a more in depth review of the season soon!
Useful Railway: Loved it. Loved the crash. Love Rex. Love the animation. (if you couldn't tell, I like Rex)
Mike's Whistle: It was really good, but the comedy felt a little overplayed by the end. It's still up there with the best, though.
Tit for Tat: RWS adaptations?! OMG!! This episode had everything. Animation was great, and Thomas' role wasn't that bad.
Skiff and the Mermaid: Loved the humour and loved the innovative concept. Nice to see the Little Western gang together again. TFC was funny.
Hugo and the Airship: The concept was a little strange. Not much really happened, and the montage was kinda odd. Still not that bad.
Engine of the Future: It grew on me. A LOT. Duncan and Sir Handel were awesome and I can't wait to see more of Hugo. Nice music too.
Buckled Tracks: Not much to say on this one. I can't tell where the focus is meant to be, and Flynn's voice is a bit annoying.
All in Vain: Finally, a James episode that I like (that's pretty rare) Great to see Edward finally do something, and the animation was ðŸ‘ŒðŸ¼
Cautious Connor: Finally, Connor gets an episode! Loved it. Loved Stephen's speech at the end too. Great episode all around.
Mucking About: Nice to see Max and Monty, as well as The Pack. Not the best, but not the worst either. The twins are a bit dumb though :P
Three Steam Engines: I actually do like this one. Nice to see the Ffarquhar trio back again. Also, Trevor is back, so that's cool.
Missing Breakdown Train: Awesome to see Judy and Jerome. They are such great characters who deserve more exposure.
Henry in the Dark: So, the scaredy becomes the scarer. Henry is in character yet again, and the episode has a innovative concept.
Over The Hill: A fun episode with the two old timers. The music was great too. Also, Thomas doesn't speak. Yay.
Christmas Coffeepot: Kinda forgettable, but really nice to see Glynn again. Nice reference to TFC building the coffeepots.
Railcar and the Coaches: Annie and Clarabel are evil but I love it! The dynamic between the three is so fun to watch, and I hope we get more
Love Me Tender: Welcome back twins! Another amazing episode. SO happy to see the twins again, and perfectly in character too,
Letters to Santa: Loved seeing Percy and Harold together again. I love the callbacks to the RWS and the ending was very sweet. Love it.
The Way She Does It: Nice to see Daisy again. I do like the episode, but can see its flaws.
Blown Away: 10/10 I am BLOWN AWAY by everything the episode has to offer. Duck and Oliver finally have a role (YAY) and Skiff is amazing.
Pouty James: It's alright, but the novelty of the faces got old after a few viewings.
Ryan and Daisy: I love it. Characters are great and it's great to see a new side of Daisy that the models couldn't capture(look at the eyes)
Saving Time: A rather dull and slow episode. It's ok I guess, but definitely not my favourite.
Bradford the Break Van: Nice to see a new rolling stock character. Watching him boss everyone around was very entertaining. + Whiff speaks.
Diesel and the Ducklings: Average. Maybe even below average. I found the episode pretty boring, and I don't see myself going back to it.
Henry Gets The Express: Welcome back! One of my wishes was fulfilled, and I couldn't be happier. What else can I say? Perfect.
Toby's New Friend: A nice, slice of life episode. Great to see Toby have a substantial role again. Him and Philip have great chemistry.
Sidney Sings: Fun and simple way to start of a season. Nice to see an underused character get used.
Incoming Season 20 thoughts
I hope we get 1080p logoless versions of the Arlesdale episodes soon. I wanna use clips in my videos :P
Thomas' role was so minimal and I'm so happy. Honestly, you can hardly notice him there.
@SamTheTrainFan just pains me to see him there clearly, but he doesn't do or say anything.
I liked TFC role in SATM. I mean, if I was stranded on a boat in the ocean, I would be shit scared and act out like that.
Gotta say, Skiff and the Mermaid was pretty brilliant. I would've liked some of Toad's lines to go to Oliver, but still good overall.
This should've been Duck and Oliver. I mean cmon, give him more roles! https://t.co/YS6ccRsOBD

1 more hour until the 31st on the east coast. One more hour until S20 is over.

Is it Arlesburgh Junction or Arlesburgh West? Make up your mind.
You know what? I like the conflicting views of everyone on here. It makes conversations a lot more fun. Keep at it people!
Hmm. Rex's bogie wheels didn't disappear in these episodes. That's nice.
@SamTheTrainFan That looks pretty poor.
@SunilFan48 I doubt they'll drop them. I think they're gonna pull a Skarloey Railway on us.
For me, my favourite Arlesdale episode is a tie between Useful Railway and Tit for Tat. Both episodes are handled amazingly.
Say goodbye to the Arlesdale Railway. I doubt we're gonna see much of them in the future unfortunately.

Wow. I absolutely adore Useful Railway. What an amazing episode.
